translation: Yuezang fengshi xiv. pinyin 6 of the Awakening of Māra's Faith

source_sentence: 爾時，有一帝釋天王名曰火光，與大眾集在於會坐，白憍尸迦帝釋言：「憍尸迦！
translation: It was then that a certain Śakra Devānām-Indra named Firelight gathered with the great assembly and said to Śubha Devānām-Indra, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 此魔波旬，為當欲令住於閑林與第一義相應菩薩摩訶薩等得三昧故勤作惱亂？
translation: Does this Māra Pāpīyān want to cause bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others who live in a quiet forest and are associated with the supreme truth to attain samādhi and therefore work diligently to disturb them?

source_sentence: 為欲退彼三昧故也？」
translation: Is it because you want to retrogress from that samādhi?"

source_sentence: 時，憍尸迦答彼火光天帝釋言：「是魔波旬，於四天下一切處中，令諸眾生退失留難善朋黨故，勤作惱亂。
translation: Kauśika then answered that fiery god Śakra, "That's Māra Pāpīyān, who diligently disturbs sentient beings in all places under the four heavens because he causes them to lose their good friends who are left behind.

source_sentence: 又令退失留難檀波羅蜜乃至般若波羅蜜故，勤作惱亂。
translation: He also causes them to retreat from the perfection of giving and the perfection of wisdom, which diligently causes them to become disturbed.

source_sentence: 復令退失天人種故、三種菩提故、增長三惡道故，勤作惱亂；魔諸眷屬亦復如是，為欲增長一切眾生大苦海故，勤作惱亂。」
translation: It also causes them to retreat from the celestial and human races, from the three kinds of enlightenment, and from the three evil destinies, and to work diligently to torment them; likewise, the Māra's retinues work diligently to torment them in order to increase the ocean of great suffering for all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 憍尸迦說是語已，于時一切諸來大眾，皆以慈心瞻視魔王。
translation: After Kauśika said those words, all the people who came from that time looked at the demon king with compassion.

source_sentence: 有諸菩薩摩訶薩等，慈愍勸諫魔王波旬。
translation: There were bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others who lovingly advised and counseled Demon King Pāpīyān.

source_sentence: 是時，火光帝釋復與一萬帝釋天眾，悉共合掌向魔波旬作如是言：「大王！
translation: At the time, Fiery Indra and the 10,000 Indra celestials joined their palms together and said to Māra Pāpīyān, "Great king!

source_sentence: 慶喜，慶喜！
translation: Rejoice, rejoice!

source_sentence: 於三寶中應生信敬。」
translation: Among the three treasures, faith and reverence should arise."

source_sentence: 是時，娑婆世界主大梵天王與六十億百千梵眾及四天王，慈心眼視魔王波旬，亦作是言：「慶喜，慶喜！
translation: At the time, the lord of the sahā world, the king of Brahmā, along with six billion, one hundred thousand Brahmans and the four heavenly kings, looked at Māra King Pāpīyān with compassionate eyes and also said, "Rejoice, rejoice!

source_sentence: 汝魔波旬，若於三寶不得信敬，未來長夜有大損失，無所利益墮諸惡道。」
translation: You Māra Pāpīyān, if you don't have faith in and respect for the Three Treasures, you'll suffer great loss in the long years ahead and fall into bad destinies without benefit."

source_sentence: 是魔波旬，為彼一切諸來大眾各各皆以慈心眼視，及諸菩薩摩訶薩等，釋天、梵天、護世四王勸諫之時，從座而起，合掌向佛，頭面禮足，而說偈言：「智者一向棄王位，　　以有煩惱嫉妬慢，　故令失壞勝善道，　　墜墮諸惡不善趣。
translation: When Māra Pāpīyān was being advised by the compassionate eyes of all the people who had come, the bodhisattvas, Mahāsattvas, and the four guardian kings, he rose from his seat, put his palms together, bowed his head and feet to the Buddha, and spoke in verse, saying, "The wise one has always abandoned the position of king because of his afflictions, jealousy, and pride, which have caused him to lose the excellent path and fall into various bad and unskillful destinies.

source_sentence: 我以富貴狂因緣，　　於善導師多留難，　遮障眾生諸善業，　　初不見佛起瞋心。
translation: Because of my wealth and insanity, I often had trouble with good teachers, hindering the good actions of sentient beings and raising my anger when I first didn't see the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊一向常忍辱，　　慈悲憐愍諸眾生，　等心一切已慢除，　　枯竭眾生煩惱海。
translation: The Bhagavān has always been patient, compassionate, and kind to sentient beings, ridding them of all conceit with equal mind and drying up the sea of affliction in sentient beings.

source_sentence: 惟佛燒盡煩惱薪，　　能示人天解脫道，　令億眾生度有海，　　我盲無智入闇冥。
translation: Only the Buddha burns up the firewood of affliction, shows humans and gods the path to liberation, and causes hundreds of millions of sentient beings to cross the ocean of existence while I'm blind and lack knowledge and enter darkness.

source_sentence: 我今啟請諸大眾，　　願以慈愍助我等，　謝過如來住堅信，　　更不重起惱亂心。
translation: Now, I'd like to inspire the masses to help us with kindness, thank the Tathāgata for abiding in firm faith, and never again give rise to a mind that's troubled.

source_sentence: 我今一向護佛法，　　熾然光顯正法眼，　自捨所有貪妬慢，　　懺悔無餘諸罪業。
translation: Now, I've always protected the Buddha's teaching, blazing brightly to reveal the true eye of the Dharma, abandoning all craving and pride on my own, and repenting of sins without remainder.

source_sentence: 我今發大菩提心，　　及勸一切眾生等，　自修精進滿六度，　　置彼眾生於八道。
translation: Now, I arouse the mind of great bodhi and encourage all sentient beings to cultivate their own effort to fulfill the six perfections and place them in the eight destinies.

source_sentence: 我為一一眾生故，　　顯說無量諸法門，　隨所能令入法城，　　如是勤勸一切眾。
translation: For the sake of each and every sentient being, I'll explain measureless teachings, cause them to enter the Dharma city as I can, and diligently encourage all of them in this way.

source_sentence: 未曾見有如此會，　　悉能淨信於三寶，　由我惡心被厭賤，　　故今捨之及眾過。
translation: I've never seen such an assembly that's fully capable of purifying faith in the Three Treasures, and because I was disgusted with my bad thoughts, I've now abandoned them and their many faults.

source_sentence: 從今永住淨信心，　　願後更不被厭賤，　心與聖德常相應，　　不復造作眾惡業。」
translation: From now on, I'll always have pure faith, hoping that I won't be disliked again, that my mind will always be in accord with noble qualities, and that I won't again create numerous bad karmas."

source_sentence: 爾時，魔王說此偈已，即向佛所。
translation: After speaking this verse, the demon king went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到已禮拜，而說偈言：「我於世尊作留難，　　願以上忍見容恕，　救孤獨者受我懺，　　大智慈仁不懷瞋。」
translation: When he arrived, he paid homage and spoke the verse, saying, "I made this difficult task for the Bhagavān, wishing to see forbearance and forgiveness from above, to save the orphan and accept my repentance, and to be greatly wise and kind without holding anger."

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸來大眾咸同一音，而白佛言：「婆伽婆！
translation: At that point, all the people who had come spoke with one voice and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯願容恕魔王波旬，魔今深信誠心懺悔，當持佛法熾然法眼，令世尊法久住於世，復使人天長夜當得利益安樂。」
translation: Please forgive Māra King Pāpīyān, for now Māra is convinced and sincerely repents, and he will maintain the Buddha's blazing Dharma eye so that the Bhagavān's teaching will long endure in the world and so that humans and gods will attain benefit and happiness for a long time."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以偈答曰：「忍為世間最，　　忍是安樂道，　忍為離孤獨，　　賢聖所欣樂。
translation: The Bhagavān then replied with a verse, "Forbearance is the best in the world, forbearance is the path to well-being, forbearance is free of loneliness, and it's a delight to good men and sages.

source_sentence: 忍能顯眾生，　　忍能作親友，　忍增美名譽，　　忍為世所愛，　忍得富自在，　　忍能具端正，　忍能得威力，　　忍照於世間，　忍得諸欲樂，　　忍能成工巧，　忍力降伏怨，　　及以除憂惱。
translation: Patience reveals sentient beings, patience makes friends, patience increases reputation, patience is loved by the world, patience attains wealth and ease, patience is correct, patience attains authority, patience illuminates the world, patience attains desires and pleasures, patience accomplishes skill, patience has the power to subdue enemies, and patience removes sorrow and vexation.

source_sentence: 忍得好容色，　　忍能具眷屬，　忍招諸勝報，　　忍能超善道，　忍得人樂觀，　　忍能得妙好，　忍能息諸苦，　　忍得壽命長，　忍得大梵王，　　忍得欲自在，　忍得天帝釋，　　輪王具神通。
translation: Patience attains good looks, patience provides for retinues, patience brings about excellent rewards, patience transcends the good path, patience is optimistic about people, patience attains marvelous beauty, patience calms suffering, patience has a long life, patience attains the king of Brahmā, patience attains freedom of desire, patience attains the god Indra, and the wheel-turning king has supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 忍得人中主，　　忍力難降伏，　忍得龍夜叉，　　修羅中自在。
translation: Patience obtains supremacy among men, forbearance is difficult to subdue, patience obtains dragons and yakṣas, and sovereignty among the asuras.

source_sentence: 忍能息諸怨，　　不害於眾生，　忍能離偷盜，　　忍能捨婬欲，　忍能止妄語，　　兩舌綺惡言。
translation: Patience quells enmity and does no harm to sentient beings, patience secures freedom from theft, patience abandons lust, patience stops false speech, and patience produces harsh speech with two tongues.

source_sentence: 忍能除貪瞋，　　及離邪見意，　忍力成施戒，　　精進及禪那，　般若波羅蜜，　　能滿此六度。
translation: Patience removes craving and ill-will, parts with wrong views, establishes the precepts of patience, makes effort, and meditates, and fulfills the six perfections of prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 忍能除諸惑，　　忍得羅漢樂，　亦得辟支佛，　　及住無生忍。
translation: Being patient, it removes mental disturbances, tolerates and attains the happiness of the arhat, and it also attains the forbearance of the pratyekabuddhas and the abiding in nonarising.

source_sentence: 忍能具十地，　　速得菩提道，　忍於諸眾生，　　得為無上勝。
translation: Being patient, it's possible to complete the ten stages, quickly attain the path to enlightenment, and tolerate sentient beings to attain unsurpassed excellence.

source_sentence: 忍能降眾魔，　　及伏諸外道，　忍能於世間，　　轉最無上輪。
translation: Being patient, it's able to subdue Māra and subdue non-Buddhists, and it's able to turn the most unsurpassed wheel in the world.

source_sentence: 忍令多眾生，　　枯竭三惡道，　忍斷煩惱障，　　及能淨法眼。
translation: Patience causes many sentient beings to dry up the three bad destinies, cuts off the afflictive hindrances, and purifies the Dharma eye.

source_sentence: 忍授眾生記，　　三乘隨所求，　忍能伏剛惡，　　夜叉羅剎等。
translation: Being patient, it grants sentient beings the assurance of knowing that the three vehicles are pursued accordingly, and it subdues the rigid and evil, such as the yakṣas and rājas.

source_sentence: 忍與種種人，　　授記最勝道，　忍已降諸怨，　　亦能滅眾惡。
translation: Being patient with various people, he grants them assurance of the supreme path, subdues enmity with patience, and extinguishes all kinds of evil.

source_sentence: 忍能息一切，　　非時暴風雨，　忍能作大集，　　此諸所來眾。
translation: Being patient, it's able to quell all tempestuous storms at odd times, and it's able to create a great gathering of people who come here.

source_sentence: 我恕汝波旬，　　於我諸獷戾，　但自謝己心，　　是我第一恕。
translation: I forgive you, Pāpīyān, for your harshness toward me, but I thank myself for this, which is the first thing I forgive.

source_sentence: 今於大眾前，　　證知勸誡汝，　莫壞我所習，　　一切佛正法。」
translation: Now, in front of the whole crowd, I will testify and admonish you not to destroy what I've practiced, which is the correct teaching of all buddhas."

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸來大眾、天人、阿修羅、乾闥婆等，同聲歎言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: At that point, all the great multitudes of people, gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas who had come praised them in one voice, saying, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 婆伽婆！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來常於一切眾生慈悲憐愍，以諸善法饒益安樂。
translation: The Tathāgata always has compassion and sympathy for all sentient beings and gives benefit and happiness to them with good qualities.

source_sentence: 魔王波旬常於世尊起憎惡心怨心害心，與諸眾生為惡知識，於諸善法常作留難令住不善。」
translation: Māra King Pāpīyān always harms the Bhagavān with hatred and resentment, makes sentient beings bad friends, and always makes it difficult to stay with unwholesome dharmas."

source_sentence: 時有梵天名曰威德，白不動大梵天王而說偈曰：「如空無邊亦無等，　　一切眾生所依住，　佛智如是不思議，　　於一切法到彼岸。
translation: At the time, a Brahma god named Bhadrika said in a verse to the king of the Akṣobhya Brahmā, "As emptiness has neither limit nor equal, all sentient beings stand on that basis, and the Buddha's wisdom is thus inconceivable, reaching the other shore of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 世尊有歎檀行處，　　憐愍一切眾生故，　以檀得為功德士，　　速能滿諸波羅蜜。
translation: The Bhagavān has a place where he praises the practice of giving, so he has compassion for all sentient beings and attains the merit of giving, which quickly fulfills the perfections.

source_sentence: 或有廣說戒忍進，　　及以禪那般若等，　世尊於此一一中，　　具足能顯於六度。
translation: Sometimes he explains in detail the practice of precepts, forbearance, and meditation and wisdom, and so forth, in each of which the Bhagavān fully expresses the six perfections.

source_sentence: 如來唯以禪定法，　　說能趣向菩提道，　是故常應樂住禪，　　速能證於大菩提。」
translation: The Tathāgata teaches that only the teaching of meditation can lead to the path of enlightenment, so you should always delight in abiding in meditation and quickly realize great bodhi."

source_sentence: 爾時，復有一切梵王、諸帝釋王、諸餘天王、諸龍王、諸夜叉王、諸阿修羅王、諸伽樓羅王、諸緊那羅王、諸乾闥婆王、諸摩睺羅伽王、諸羅剎王、諸鳩槃茶王、諸餓鬼王、諸毘舍遮王等，從座而起向魔波旬，合掌而禮，作如是言：「大王敬信敬信牟尼世尊，以此世尊解脫諸過，到於一切功德彼岸。
translation: At the time, all the brahma kings, Śakra kings, other god kings, dragon kings, yakṣa kings, asura kings, garuḍa kings, kiṃnara kings, gandharva kings, mahoraga kings, rāṣṭrapāla kings, kumbhāṇḍa kings, hungry ghost kings, and piśācī kings rose from their seats and bowed their palms to Māra Pāpīyān, saying, "Great king, we respect and believe in Bhagavān Muni, for this Bhagavān is liberated from all faults and has reached the other shore of all merits.

source_sentence: 慈悲憐愍諸眾生等，施一切樂覺了諸法，捨諸流轉住於彼岸。」
translation: He has compassion for sentient beings and others, gives them all joy, realizes all dharmas, and abides on the other side, free from all transmigration."

source_sentence: 又言：「大王！
translation: He also said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 若有眾生，乃至一念深信如來敬仰尊重歎未曾有，以敬信故得作輪王，統四天下七寶具足，乃至得作帝釋天王，欲自在主魔王波旬，娑婆界主大梵天王，何況常能具信三寶！
translation: If there are sentient beings who, even with a moment's thought, firmly believe that the Tathāgata honors and respects them as never before, and because of that reverence and faith they become wheel-turning kings, rulers of the four worlds with their full complement of seven treasures, and even become kings of the Indra Heaven, Māra King Pāpīyān, lord of the desire realm, and Mahābrahma King of the Śāvaka Heaven, how much more can they always fully believe in the Three Treasures!

source_sentence: 是故，大王！
translation: Therefore, great king!

source_sentence: 應捨魔見諸惡濁心具足淨信，於生死流轉富貴自在受諸果報，後成正覺能施眾生一切安樂，得為世間無上福田。」
translation: They should abandon their views of Māra and all the negative turbidities in their minds and possess pure faith, transmigrate through birth and death, become wealthy and powerful, and enjoy the results, and then become completely enlightened, bestow all happiness on sentient beings, and attain the unsurpassed field of merit in the world."

source_sentence: 爾時，魔王復與諸臣頂禮佛足，專心敬信牟尼世尊慇懃懺謝。
translation: At that point, Māra King and his ministers bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, dedicated their hearts to faith, and the World Honored Muni gave him a warm apology.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以偈告曰：「惡心姦慧汝當起，　　我常容忍天人證，　至心修行菩提道，　　汝當作佛無邊慧。」
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed them in a verse, "Bad-minded adulterer of wisdom you must arouse, for I always tolerate the realization of gods and humans, and while wholeheartedly cultivating the path to enlightenment, you must achieve the Buddha's limitless wisdom."

source_sentence: 爾時，魔王極生淨信，即持無價摩尼寶鬘，無價咽瓔珞、臂瓔珞、脚瓔珞及以指印，奉獻世尊，合掌而禮，作如是言：「我昔於佛多作留難，為欲破壞正法眼目、斷三寶種、壞滅法炬。
translation: At that point, the Māra King, having utmost pure faith, presented the Bhagavān with a priceless maṇi-jeweled garland, priceless necklace, arm and leg jewelry, and a fingerprint, put his palms together, saluted, and said, "In the past, I made a lot of trouble for the Buddha because I wanted to damage the eyes of the true teaching, cut off the seeds of the three treasures, and destroy the torch of the teaching.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 遠離善法迷惑心故。
translation: "He's far removed from the deluded mind of the good Dharma.

source_sentence: 今於三寶深得敬信，本昔所作一切業障今已懺悔，已發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心蒙得授記。
translation: Now, I've deeply revered the Three Treasures, confessed all the karmic hindrances I've done in the past, and have aroused the aspiration for unsurpassed, corrected, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊，哀受我等摩尼寶鬘瓔珞指印。」
translation: Please let the Bhagavān have mercy on us and accept our precious maṇi garlands, diademed fingerprints, and mudrās."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊慈悲憐愍魔波旬故，即便受之。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān compassionately took pity on Māra Pāpīyān, so he even accepted it.

source_sentence: 爾時，魔王心生大喜，作如是言：「若佛所有聲聞弟子，比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，若復餘人，宴坐閑林與第一義相應住者，現在、未來若魔、魔子、魔婦、魔女，魔諸左右、男夫婦女，及依魔住所有眾生，若天天子天婦天女，天諸左右、男夫婦女，若龍龍子龍婦龍女，龍諸左右、男夫婦女，乃至迦吒富單那若子若婦若女。
translation: At that point, the demon king became greatly elated and said, "If there were śrāvaka disciples of the Buddha, monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen, and laypeople, and if there were any others who sit in a quiet forest and abide in association with the supreme truth, then there would be Māra, Māra's sons, Māra's wives, Māra's daughters, Māra's attendants, Māra's sons and attendants, men, husbands, and wives, and all the sentient beings who rely on Māra, if there were gods, gods' sons, gods' wives, gods' attendants, men, husbands, and wives, if there were dragons, dragons' sons, dragons' wives, dragons' attendants, men, husbands, and wives, up to Kāṭapūtana, if there were sons, wives, and women.

source_sentence: 若諸左右、男夫婦女，嬈亂衰害取其精氣，氣噓其身散亂其心，若奪衣服飲食湯藥，若教他奪若奪其味，若以鼻嗅若放臭氣滿其住處，若復見彼住於閑林比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷及餘眾生修第一義者，若不勤作供給供養衣服飲食及以湯藥，我當令彼若魔魔子，乃至迦吒富單那左右男女，得頭病眼病耳病腹病，如是等病之所逼惱，退失神通不復能得飛空遠逝，一切方所皆迷闇冥。」
translation: If those left and right [beings], men, husbands, and women disturb and impair their energy, exhale their bodies, scatter their minds, snatch clothing, food, drink, and medicine, teach others to snatch and plunder their taste, sniff with their noses, or release bad breath to fill their dwelling places, and if they are seen living in a quiet forest as monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen, or other beings cultivating the supreme truth and don't diligently make offerings of clothing, food, drink, and medicine, I will cause them, whether Māra, Māra's son, or even Kāṭapūtana's left and right [men and women], to get headaches, eye problems, ear problems, stomach problems, and such like illnesses that constrain them, lose their powers, stop being able to fly off into the sky, and become confused and obscure in all directions."

source_sentence: 魔王波旬復作是言：「若有違我此教令者，當得如上眾病等惱。
translation: Again, Māra King Pāpīyān said, "If someone disobeys my teaching and orders, they'll be afflicted by numerous illnesses like the above.

source_sentence: 復次，世尊！
translation: "Furthermore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今攝護佛子聲聞伏諸惡行，不令現在及未來世作諸衰惱，能使世尊法眼久住，令三寶種不斷於世。」
translation: Now, I will guard the disciples and śrāvakas of the Buddha from unwholesome actions that will cause trouble in the present and future generations and will enable the Bhagavān's Dharma eye to endure for a long time, so that the seeds of the Three Treasures will not be lost in the world."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復讚魔言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān again praised Māra, saying, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 如是波旬！
translation: Thus it is, Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 汝於長夜具大功德，無復諸惡一切衰惱。」
translation: During that long night, you possessed great merit and were free of all the troubles of evil."

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸來大眾，諸天及人、乾闥婆等皆悉讚言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: At that point, all the people who came, gods, humans, and gandharvas alike praised them, saying, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 魔王波旬能於三寶深得淨信，如是佛法長夜熾然，天人當得入無畏城，閉塞惡道、常開善趣解脫之門，於四天下所有鬪諍、疫病、飢饉、非時風雨皆得休息。
translation: When Māra King Pāpīyān deeply attains pure faith in the Three Treasures, the Buddha's teaching will be blazing for a long time, and gods and humans will be able to enter the city of fearlessness, shut off bad destinies and always open the door to liberation in good destinies, so that all the fights, epidemics, hunger, and unseasonable winds and rain in the four worlds will find rest.

source_sentence: 又令四天下常得安隱、豐樂，可樂多眾盈滿。」
translation: It will also cause the four worlds to always be peaceful and abundant, and there will be a multitude of pleasant things to fill them."

source_sentence: 爾時，魔王禮世尊足，右遶三匝退坐一面。
translation: At that point, the demon king bowed his head at the Bhagavān's feet, circled him three times to his right, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾欲重明此義，以偈頌曰：「魔心決定得歡喜，　　懺謝如來及眷屬，　真心踊悅作是語，　　慈悲人前捨諸惡。
translation: Wishing to reintroduce this meaning, the crowd then spoke in verse, "The Māra's mind is definitely elated, thanks the Tathāgata and his retinue, is truly elated, and says this, 'Mercifully, let's abandon all evil before people.'

source_sentence: 猶如虛空無邊際，　　佛智境界亦如是，　覺了無邊諸法已，　　於世說法最第一。
translation: They're like space without limit, so is the sphere of the Buddha's wisdom, and having realized the limitless dharmas, they're the best at teaching the Dharma in the world.

source_sentence: 或有說檀勝無等，　　以檀能得妙菩提，　或復有說尸羅忍，　　精進禪定及智慧，　如是種種方便說，　　示現無等大菩提，　天人修羅應當知，　　世尊降伏自在魔。
translation: Some teach that the excellence of sandalwood is unequalled, that sandalwood leads to wonderful enlightenment, or another teaches the tolerance of Śīla, diligent meditation, and wisdom, and so forth, demonstrating the peerless great enlightenment that gods, humans, and sūtras should know, as the Bhagavān subdues the self-contained Māra.

source_sentence: 此經佛說忍為最，　　能得一切安隱樂，　忍能休息諸煩惱，　　能示勝妙解脫城。
translation: This is the sūtra where the Buddha teaches that forbearance is the greatest, that it's capable of attaining all peace and happiness, that it's capable of resting the afflictions, and that it can reveal the city of excellent and wonderful liberation.

source_sentence: 卑心合掌咸向佛，　　懺悔已作諸惡業，　當發最勝菩提願，　　我等必當作導師。
translation: With humble hearts and folded palms, they all bow to the Buddha, repenting of the bad deeds they've done and making the supreme vow of enlightenment, we will surely be your guides.

source_sentence: 自然如來授記已，　　魔王速成等正覺，　及餘百千眾生等，　　亦與無上菩提記。
translation: Naturally, after the Tathāgata grants him the prediction, the demon king will quickly become perfectly enlightened, and hundreds of thousands of other sentient beings will also receive the prediction of unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 已滿忍辱波羅蜜，　　速為無等大導師，　與諸善法作依止，　　護諸聲聞故說呪。
translation: Having fulfilled the perfection of patience, he'll quickly become a peerless great teacher, making good qualities his support and protecting the śrāvakas as he speaks the mantra.

source_sentence: 若魔依魔諸神鬼，　　夜叉修羅富單那，　如有惱害佛子者，　　當以惡病著其身。
translation: If Māra, Māra, the spirits, or Yakṣa, Šūra, and Pūtanā were to harm the Buddha's son, a bad illness would be placed on his body.

source_sentence: 一切大眾皆踊悅，　　歡喜咸作如是言，　以此業故法熾盛，　　則得久住於世間。
translation: The whole assembly is overjoyed and rejoices, saying, "Because of this action, the Dharma flourishes, and then it will be possible to live in the world for a long time.

source_sentence: 魔王安住淨忍心，　　三寶水泉難枯竭，　當息世間一切濁，　　飢饉暴風及亢旱。
translation: When the king of Māra abides in pure tolerance, the springs of the Three Treasures will hardly dry up, and they'll quell all the world's turbidity, famine, storms, and drought.

source_sentence: 是故人天得諸樂，　　本所修習忍辱行，　樂檀尸羅忍方便，　　到進禪智大彼岸。」
translation: Therefore, humans and gods attain the happiness of those who originally cultivated the practice of forbearance, enjoyed the skillful means of patience of Donaśīla, and reached the great other shore of advancing meditation and knowledge."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊顯說如是忍功德時，九百八十萬諸天人等曾修忍者，一切悉得無生法忍；十頻婆羅百千人得柔順忍；億那由他百千天人得須陀洹果。
translation: When the Bhagavān revealed the merit of such forbearance, 9.8 million gods and humans who had cultivated ninjutsu all attained the forbearance of the nonarising of the Dharma, 10 Bimbisāra hundreds of thousands attained the forbearance of gentleness, and 100 million nayutas hundreds of thousands of gods attained the fruit of stream entry.

source_sentence: 過於數量諸眾生等得世正見；十頻婆羅、百千天人、阿修羅、夜叉、羅剎，昔未曾發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心者，悉得發心及不退轉；百萬眾生得授阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記。
translation: More than a handful of sentient beings attain the right view of the world; ten bandhas, a hundred thousand gods, asuras, yakṣas, and rājas who had never before aroused the mind for unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and nonretrogression; and a million sentient beings are granted the assurance of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大方等大集經月藏分第十四一切
translation: The fourteenth item in the Yuezang section of the Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra

source_sentence: 鬼神集會品第七
translation: The Seventh Chapter of the Assemblies of Ghosts and Spirits

source_sentence: 爾時，護世四大天王，從座而起合掌向佛，頭面禮拜，作如是言：「婆伽婆！
translation: At that point, the four guardian celestial kings rose from their seats, joined their palms to the Buddha, bowed their heads, and made these words, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此閻浮提種種國土、城邑、村落、園林、寺舍、山澤等處，所有諸惡天、龍、夜叉、羅剎、阿修羅、鳩槃茶、餓鬼、毘舍遮、富單那、迦吒富單那、依彼住者，瞋惡穬戾無慚無愧，於諸眾生無有慈愍，常害他命及作惱亂。
translation: In these various lands, cities, villages, gardens, monasteries, mountains, and swamps of Jambudvīpa, there are all these bad gods, dragons, yakṣas, rājas, asuras, kumbhāṇas, hungry ghosts, piśācīs, pūtanas, and kaṭapūtanas who depend on them, who are angry, mean, and arrogant, lack compassion, and have no compassion for sentient beings, and who always harm the lives of others and cause disruption.

source_sentence: 彼諸天、龍乃至迦吒富單那等，於閻浮提非時數數起於亢旱、惡風、雹雨、闇曀、灰塵、嚴寒毒熱，以是災害壞諸苗稼、五穀、花果、蒱萄、甘蔗、劫貝等物，故令眾生多有種種飢饉疫病愛別離苦眾惱逼切，各各迭相怖懼鬪戰心常恐畏。
translation: Those gods and dragons and even Kāṭapūtana cause uncountable hardships, droughts, bad winds, hail and rain, sunsets, dust, cold and heat in Jambudvīpa, and these disasters destroy crops, grains, flowers and fruits, grapes, sugarcane, kharps, and other things, causing sentient beings to suffer from various kinds of hunger, epidemics, craving, isolation, suffering, and distress, and they are constantly afraid of each other and fight with fear.

source_sentence: 諸王剎利於己眷屬五欲眾具不生憙樂，於己國土觸惱一切沙門、婆羅門、毘舍、首陀、男夫婦女、童男童女，亦復觸惱象馬、牛羊、師子、虎豹、豺狼、狗犬，一切禽獸皆令觸惱。
translation: Kings and bhadras don't give rise to jealousy for the five desirable things that belong to their retinue, and in their own land they come into contact with and disturb all ascetics, brāhmaṇas, piśācīs, śūdras, husbands, wives, boys and girls, as well as elephants, horses, cattle, sheep, lions, tigers, lions, wolves, dogs, and all animals.

source_sentence: 於諸眾生種種因緣而逼惱之，晝夜殺害燒煮割截，五穀財帛所欲供具身心樂事，及諸善行皆悉損減。
translation: They cause various kinds of persecution of sentient beings, killing, burning, and cutting them up day and night, making desired offerings of grain, food, and clothing for their physical and mental pleasures, and performing other good deeds are all diminished.

source_sentence: 以是因緣令人天等善趣減少，又令閻浮提善事滅故不可愛樂，我等一切不能遮護。
translation: As a result, the good destinies of gods and others are diminished, and the good deeds of Jambudvīpa are destroyed, making them unattractive and unlikeable to all of us.

source_sentence: 今此世尊大集之處，一切大士菩薩摩訶薩、諸聲聞眾皆悉雲集，一切天王及與眷屬，一切龍王阿修羅王，乃至一切毘舍遮王，悉與眷屬皆來集會。
translation: Now, at this great gathering of the Bhagavān, all the great men, bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and śrāvakas have gathered in great clouds, and all the god kings and their retinues, all the dragon kings, all the asura kings, and even all the Vaiśeṣika kings have gathered here with their retinues.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼等於此閻浮提一切國土、城邑、村落、山谷、寺舍、園林之處。
translation: "Here in Jambudvīpa, there are all lands, cities, villages, valleys, monasteries, and gardens.

source_sentence: 惟願世尊分張付囑，天、龍、夜叉、羅剎、阿修羅、鳩槃茶、餓鬼、毘舍遮等，各令護持。
translation: May the Bhagavān explain and entrust them to the gods, dragons, yakṣas, rāṣas, asuras, kumbhāṇḍas, hungry ghosts, and piśācīs to guard them each.

source_sentence: 若彼天、龍乃至毘舍遮，於閻浮提作於一切鬪諍觸惱，非時風雨、疫病、飢饉、寒熱等事，各各隨分而遮護之。
translation: If those gods, dragons, or even Vaiśācīs cause all kinds of quarrels and conflicts in Jambudvīpa, unseasonable rain and wind, epidemics, hunger, cold, and heat, each will guard them according to their part.

source_sentence: 若於閻浮提所有鬪諍、觸惱、疫病、飢饉、非時風雨、寒熱等事皆悉休息，令閻浮提所有華果、藥草、劫貝、財帛、五穀、甘蔗、蒱萄，及酪蜜等皆得成熟，所有苗稼不令衰壞。
translation: If he were to rest from all the fights, conflicts, epidemics, famines, unseasonable winds and rain, cold and heat, and other things in Jambudvīpa, he would cause all the flowers and fruits, medicinal plants, plunder and shells, valuables, grains, sugarcane, grapes, butter and honey in Jambudvīpa to ripen, and prevent all the crops in Jambudvīpa from decaying.

source_sentence: 於閻浮提諸處人中及麞鹿、鳥獸，隨其所欲皆無乏少。
translation: Among the people of Jambudvīpa and the wild deer, birds, and animals that roam its grounds, there's no lack.

source_sentence: 以無乏故，令彼眾生修諸善行，修正法行修真實行勤修而住，令彼諸善增長不退。
translation: Because there's no lack, it causes sentient beings to cultivate good qualities, cultivate the practice of correcting qualities, and truly cultivate and abide in diligence, so that their good qualities will grow and not regress.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，此閻浮提安隱豐盛人多盈滿甚可愛樂。
translation: Because of this, this Jambudvīpa is peaceful and abundant, and its people are abundant and delightful.

source_sentence: 世尊正法則得久住，一切人天所願滿足，眾生悉得趣向善道及涅槃道離三惡趣，令三寶種得不斷絕。」
translation: The Bhagavān's right teaching then can be long-lasting, fulfilling the wishes of all humans and gods, and enabling sentient beings to be headed for the good path and the path to nirvāṇa and escape the three bad destinies, so that the seeds of the Three Treasures can be uninterrupted."

source_sentence: 爾時，四天王欲重明此義，以偈頌曰：「於此閻浮提，　　所有諸國土，　惡天龍夜叉，　　羅剎鳩槃茶，　餓鬼毘舍遮，　　迦吒富單那，　瞋惡無恩養，　　無慈於眾生。
translation: Desiring to explain this meaning again, the four heavenly kings then spoke in verse, "Here in Jambudvīpa, of all the lands, there are bad gods, dragons, nightjars, Rāṣṭrapāṇas, hungry ghosts, Vaiśāsīci, and Kāṭapūdana, who are angry and ungrateful and lack compassion for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 彼等無慚愧，　　觸惱諸剎利，　沙門婆羅門，　　毘舍及首陀，　師子象虎豹，　　非時惡風雨，　疫病及飢饉，　　能令眾生苦。
translation: Without conscience, they touch the bhadras, ascetics, Brahmans, Vaiśāsas, and Śuddhas, lions, elephants, tigers, and leopards, and cause sentient beings to suffer from bad winds and rain, epidemics, and famine at ungodly hours.

source_sentence: 彼等害眾生，　　毀壞於世間，　殘害諸苗稼，　　及滅正法燈，　我等四天王，　　不能遮此惡。
translation: They harm sentient beings, destroy the world, decimate crops, and extinguish the lamp of the true teaching, and we four celestial kings can't stop that evil.

source_sentence: 願佛當分布，　　國土城邑等，　付囑龍夜叉，　　羅剎鳩槃茶，　令彼各遮護，　　非時惡風雨，　息諸怖畏惱，　　令無病飢饉，　華果藥苗稼，　　充足眾美味，　眾生不乏少，　　所用諸供具。
translation: May the Buddha distribute lands, cities, and towns, instruct dragons, yakṣas, and Rāṣṭrapāṇas to guard them, stop bad winds and rain at odd times, quell fears and anxieties, prevent sickness and hunger, produce flowers and medicines, and bring in crops of delicious foods, so that sentient beings don't lack the things they need to make offerings.

source_sentence: 一切善法增，　　令得可樂事，　佛法得久住，　　眾生趣善道，　三寶種不絕，　　願佛常哀愍。
translation: All good qualities increase, making things enjoyable, the Buddha's teaching is long-lasting, sentient beings are headed for a good path, the seeds of the Three Treasures are not cut off, and may the Buddha always have compassion on them.

source_sentence: 大地具眾美，　　離諸苦辛味，　華果皆具足，　　種種味充滿，　泉池陂河等，　　淨水常充滿，　於諸苗稼等，　　不能奪精氣。
translation: The earth is full of beauty, free from bitter and pungent flavors, replete with flowers and fruits, and filled with various flavors, and its springs, pools, rivers, and so forth are always filled with pure water, which can't rob seedlings and other crops of their vitality.

source_sentence: 彼所進飲食，　　心軟無麁穬，　慈念常相向，　　流轉淨無垢，　捨家眾事業，　　住於阿蘭若。
translation: What they eat and drink, their minds are soft and not crude, their mindfulness is always directed toward kindness, their flow is pure and undefiled, and they abandon all their family undertakings and abide in Araṇya.

source_sentence: 勤修菩提行，　　令多眾生信，　法朋得增益，　　令魔眾損減，　四天下豐樂，　　諸處人充滿。」
translation: They diligently cultivate the practice of enlightenment, cause many sentient beings to believe, gain friends in the Dharma, cause the demons to decrease, make the four worlds abundant and happy, and fill them with people."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊問四天王、釋提桓因、娑婆世界主、大梵等言：「諸天王輩！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān asked the four heavenly kings, Śakra Devānām-Indra, the lord of the sahā world, and Brahmā, saying, "Heavenly kings!

source_sentence: 若見若聞此賢劫初拘留孫佛，及拘那含牟尼佛、迦葉佛等出現世時，云何以此閻浮提中所有天、龍、夜叉、鳩槃茶等分張付囑，為如我今菩提樹下初成正覺，以此一切閻浮提中天、龍、夜叉、鳩槃茶等分張付囑安置不也？」
translation: If you see and hear the first Kauśāmbī, Kanakamuni, Kāśyapa, and others of these eons when they appeared in the world, why did they give instructions in parts to all the gods, dragons, yakṣas, kumbhâṇḍas, and so forth in Jambudvīpa, just as I have done now under the bodhi tree when I first became perfectly enlightened, to place them in parts to all the gods, dragons, yakṣas, kumbhâṇḍas, and so forth in Jambudvīpa?"

source_sentence: 如是問已，四大天王、釋提桓因、娑婆世界主、大梵王等白佛言：「大德婆伽婆！
translation: After asking this question, the four heavenly kings, Śakra Devānām-Indra, the lord of the sahā world, and the king of Brahmā said to the Buddha, "Venerable Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等見聞此賢劫初拘留孫佛菩提樹下初成正覺，以此閻浮提天、龍、夜叉、鳩槃茶等分張付囑，如今世尊菩提樹下初成正覺，以此閻浮提天、龍夜叉鳩槃茶等分張付囑等無有異。
translation: We've seen and heard that at the beginning of this good eon, when Kauśāmbī first became perfectly enlightened under the bodhi tree, this was a manifestation of the instructions given by the gods of Jambudvīpa, dragons, yakṣas, and kumbhāṇḍas, and there's nothing different about the present time when the Bhagavān first became perfectly enlightened under the bodhi tree and this was a manifestation of the instructions given by the gods of Jambudvīpa, dragons, yakṣas, and kumbhāṇḍas.

source_sentence: 彼拘留孫佛出現世時，眾生壽命四萬歲，彼時大地精氣、眾生精氣、法精氣等，力得增上，味增上、威增上、德增上、慈增上、勝增上、智增上，如是等事皆得增上。
translation: When that Kauśāmbī appeared in the world, the life expectancy of sentient beings was 40,000 years, and at that time the vitality of the earth, the vitality of sentient beings, and the vitality of the Dharma increased in strength, taste, authority, virtue, kindness, victory, and wisdom, and so forth.

source_sentence: 爾時，依地果味眾華藥等，眾生食者皆得軟心、慈心、悲心、喜心、捨心、施心、戒心、忍心、精進心、禪定心、智慧心、離殺生心，乃至離邪見心。
translation: At that point, depending on the taste of the fruits of the earth, the many flowers and medicines and so forth, sentient beings who eat them will attain a mind of tenderness, kindness, pity, joy, equanimity, generosity, discipline, forbearance, effort, meditation, wisdom, freedom from killing, and even freedom from wrong views.

source_sentence: 少欲知足少煩惱垢，多福長壽離欲閑居，愛樂正法厭患流轉熾三寶種。
translation: With few desires and satisfactions, they'll have few afflictive defilements, many merits and long lives, freedom from desire, and a love of the right Dharma that's disillusioned with the transmigration of the blazing seed of the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，得離惡道趣向善道。
translation: Because of these causes, they'll be freed from bad states and headed for a good state of existence.

source_sentence: 「爾時，諸天乃至迦吒富單那，一切禽獸悉得具足如是等事。
translation: "At that point, the gods, even Kāṭapūtana, and all the animals are fully equipped to do such things.

source_sentence: 次後眾生名壽損減，名壽損減故福德損減，福德損減故地味精氣損減，地味精氣損減故眾生精氣損減，眾生精氣損減故眾生心法作善慚愧損減，眾生心法作善慚愧損減故正法甘露精氣損減。
translation: Subsequently, the name-and-life of sentient beings is diminished, and because their name-and-life is diminished, their merit is diminished, their virtue is diminished because their virtue is diminished, their earthly flavor and vitality is diminished because their earthly flavor and vitality is diminished, the vitality of sentient beings is diminished because their vitality is diminished, their mental states of activity are made good and conscience is diminished because their mental states of activity are made good and conscience is diminished, and the vitality of the true Dharma nectar is diminished because their mental states of activity are made good and conscience is diminished.

source_sentence: 彼諸眾生名壽損減，乃至正法甘露精氣損減故，廣作殺生乃至邪見，乃至禽獸亦復如是。
translation: As their names and lives are diminished, and as the energy of the true dharma's ambrosia is diminished, those sentient beings engage in extensive killing and even mistaken views, and even animals are likewise.

source_sentence: 如是眾生遠離善道及涅槃道趣向惡道，彼命終已生惡道中。
translation: Thus, sentient beings are removed from the good path and the path to nirvāṇa and headed for a bad path, and they're born in a bad path after their lives end.

source_sentence: 若彼眾生生於夜叉乃至迦吒富單那中者，瞋惡無慈不視後世可怖畏事，廣作殺生乃至邪見。
translation: If those sentient beings are born among the yakṣas or even among the kaṭapūtanas, they become angry and unmerciful, don't look at the terrible things of the afterlife, and generally commit murder and even mistaken views.

source_sentence: 彼等眾生於閻浮提，未得入於付囑護持分中。
translation: Such sentient beings in Jambudvīpa won't be able to enter the portion of the entrustment that protects them.

source_sentence: 「如是拘那含牟尼佛、迦葉佛，於菩提樹下初成正覺，以此閻浮提天、龍、夜叉、鳩槃茶等分張付囑，如今世尊於道樹下初成正覺，以此閻浮提天、龍、夜叉、鳩槃茶等分張付囑等無有異。
translation: "Thus, when Kanakamuni Buddha and Kāśyapa Buddha first became fully awakened under the bodhi tree, this was a manifestation of the instructions given to the gods, dragons, yakṣas, and kumbhâṇḍas of Jambudvīpa, and there's nothing different about this manifestation of the instructions given to the gods, dragons, yakṣas, and kumbhâṇḍas of Jambudvīpa now that the Bhagavān has first become fully awakened under the tree of the way.

source_sentence: 「如是白法漸減黑法增長，從是已來，無量那由他百千惡龍、夜叉乃至迦吒富單那生長番息，常瞋穬惡不懷慚愧，於諸眾生無有慈心，不觀後世可怖畏事，殘害他命食其血肉。
translation: "Thus, as the white dharmas gradually decrease and the black dharmas increase, measureless hundreds of thousands of evil dragons and yakṣas up to Kāṭapūtana grow and flourish from this point on, always holding anger and bearing ill will and lacking conscience, they lack compassion for sentient beings, don't contemplate the fearful things of the afterlife, and slaughter the lives of others to eat their flesh and blood.

source_sentence: 彼等不入分布分中無定住處，此惡龍等不守護人乃至畜生，常欲奪人精氣斷他命根，滅壞國土、城邑、村落、寺舍等處，能令諸王瞋惱，乃至能令畜生等惱。
translation: They don't enter the portion of the distribution where there's no set dwelling place, and these evil dragons don't guard people or even animals, always want to steal people's energy and cut off their life roots, destroy lands, cities, villages, temples, and other places, cause the anger of kings, and even cause animals and others to be vexed.

source_sentence: 又復，能令非時風雨嚴寒毒熱，壞滅一切華實苗稼，如是惡龍乃至迦吒富單那等不受我教，我於彼等不得自在，是故於今五濁極惡白法損減。
translation: Furthermore, it can cause unseasonable winds and rain, severe cold and heat, and destruction of all flowers and crops, so that evil dragons and even Kāṭapūtana won't accept my teaching and I can't be at ease with them, which is why the five turbid and extremely bad white dharmas are now diminished.

source_sentence: 「如來出世，一切眾生於慈導師得生敬信尊重愛樂，佛所發言稱機利益，具足功德智慧之聚得成大悲。
translation: "When the Tathāgata appears in the world, all sentient beings become respectful, faithful, honorable, and delightful in their compassionate teacher, and the Buddha's speech praises the benefits of his abilities and the full accumulation of merit and wisdom to achieve great compassion.

source_sentence: 六波羅蜜相應究竟所願得滿，獲六神通於法自在，覆護攝受一切眾生，能與眾生一切善道及涅槃樂。
translation: They accomplish the ultimate fulfillment of their wishes in accord with the six perfections, attain mastery over the Dharma with the six supernormal powers, protect and embrace all sentient beings, and are able to share with them all the good destinies and the bliss of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 今者於此本未曾有、昔來未聞如是大集，一切天王及與眷屬皆來集會，一切龍王乃至日王、夜叉王、羅剎王、阿修羅王、乾闥婆王、緊那羅王、伽樓羅王、摩睺羅伽王、鳩槃茶王、餓鬼王、毘舍遮王，悉與眷屬皆來集此。
translation: Now, at this great gathering, which has never existed before or been heard of in the past, all the god kings and their retinues come to assemble, and all the dragon kings, even the sun kings, night kings, rāṣṭrapāla kings, asura kings, gandharva kings, kiṃnara kings, garuḍa kings, mahoraga kings, kumbhāṇḍa kings, hungry ghost kings, and piśācī kings, along with their retinues, come to assemble here.

source_sentence: 所未來者，今願世尊，以神通力盡皆攝之。
translation: May the Bhagavān now use his supernormal powers to gather all of those who have yet to come.

source_sentence: 若有諸惡鬼神無所繫屬，不受他教瞋惡麁獷無有慈愍，不觀後世可怖畏事，殘害他命飲血食肉。
translation: Suppose there are evil spirits that have no tethers, don't accept other teachings, are hateful and harsh without compassion, don't contemplate frightening events in the afterlife, and maim people to drink blood and eat flesh.

source_sentence: 所不來者，惟願世尊當復慈愍，以神通力命彼鬼神及其眷屬皆來至此，使得分布入他分中，不令數數惱亂眾生，以此方便令四天下大地餘味而不速滅，精氣安住不復損減。
translation: If they don't come, may the Bhagavān again be compassionate and order those spirits and their retinues to come here with miraculous powers, allowing them to distribute them into other parts, not to repeatedly disturb sentient beings, and use this as a way to cause the remaining flavors of the earth under the four heavens not to quickly cease and for the vitality to remain stable and not decrease again.

source_sentence: 以地精氣不損減故，眾生精氣住不損減；眾生精氣不損減故，正法甘露精氣住不損減；正法甘露精氣不損減故，眾生心法作善平等增長。
translation: Because the earth's vitality isn't diminished, the vitality of sentient beings doesn't decrease; because the vitality of sentient beings doesn't decrease, the vitality of the true dharma-nectar doesn't decrease; and because the vitality of the true dharma-nectar doesn't decrease, the mental states of sentient beings are created with goodness and equal growth.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，令三寶種得不斷絕。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, the seeds of the Three Treasures are made uninterrupted.

source_sentence: 如是如是，法眼久住，閉三惡道開於善趣及涅槃門。
translation: Thus and thus, the Dharma eye remains long-lasting, closing the three bad destinies and opening the door to a good destiny and nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 如是如是，白法增長黑法損減。
translation: Thus and thus, white dharmas will increase and black dharmas will decrease.

source_sentence: 如是如是，天人增長，無量天人悉得充足涅槃快樂。」
translation: Thus and thus, the gods and humans will grow, and measureless gods and humans will attain the happiness of full nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 四天王等說是語時，世尊觀察默然不言。
translation: When the four celestial kings and others said those words, the Bhagavān observed in silence.

source_sentence: 爾時，娑婆世界主大梵天王、憍尸迦及諸釋天、四大天王，皆共合掌告諸大眾：「我等咸白一切菩薩摩訶薩、一切聲聞、一切天、龍、夜叉、羅剎、乾闥婆、阿修羅、緊那羅、伽樓羅、摩睺羅伽、餓鬼、毘舍遮、富單那等一切大眾，願悉勸請如來法尊，當使世尊令諸天眾悉集於此，一切龍眾乃至一切迦吒富單那等亦悉來集。
translation: At the time, the lord of the Saiva world, the king of Brahmā, Kauśika, the Śakra gods, and the four celestial kings all joined their palms and addressed the crowd, "We all say to all the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, all śrāvakas, all gods, dragons, yakṣas, rāṣas, gandharvas, asuras, kiṃnaras, garuḍas, mahoragas, hungry ghosts, piśācīs, pūtanas, and other great multitudes that we would like to encourage the Tathāgata to honor the Dharma, and that the Bhagavān will cause all the gods to gather here, and all the dragons and even all the kaṭṭapūtanas to come and gather here.

source_sentence: 彼等於閻浮提所有國土、城邑、村落、寺舍、園林、山谷、曠野、河井、泉池，如是等處遊止住者分張付囑，令彼一切諸善天、龍乃至一切迦吒富單那分取安置，各自當分平等守護，不令縱捨不令生惱，各各教彼同行其法，常作善念折伏惡心，復令各各護持自分，而不縱捨不惱於他。
translation: Those of you who wander and stay in such places as the lands, cities, villages, temples, forests, valleys, wildernesses, rivers, wells, and springs of Jambudvīpa will each be instructed to take and place all the good gods, dragons, and even all the Kāṭṭapūtanas equally, guard their respective parts equally, not allowing them to abandon or become afflicted, teach each of them to follow the Dharma, always be well-intentioned, subdue bad thoughts, and cause each to guard its part and not abandon or afflict others.

source_sentence: 彼若各各當分平等作護持者，名稱流布得大勇猛獲大福報。」
translation: If they each guard their own part equally, their name will spread, and they'll attain great courage and obtain great rewards of merit."

source_sentence: 爾時，一切菩薩摩訶薩、一切聲聞，一切天、龍、夜叉、羅剎、阿修羅、伽樓羅、緊那羅、乾闥婆、摩睺羅伽、鳩槃茶、餓鬼、毘舍遮、富單那、迦吒富單那，乃至一切諸來大眾，歡喜踊躍從座而起，合掌向佛，一時同聲作如是言：「我等勸請如來、應供、正遍知，愍我等故，利眾生故，得大悲心一切諸天乃至迦吒富單那悉令集此。
translation: At the time, all the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, all śrāvakas, all gods, dragons, yakṣas, rāṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, gandharvas, mahoragas, kumbhāṇas, hungry ghosts, piśācīs, pūrṇas, kaṭapūrṇas, and all the masses of people who had come before them rose from their seats in joyous exuberance, joined their palms together, and addressed the Buddha with one voice, saying, "We urge the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Omniscient One to gather here all the gods and even kaṭapūrṇas with great compassion, for our sake and for the sake of the benefit of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 彼等於此閻浮提中城邑村落乃至依止泉池住者，分張付囑，令彼天、龍乃至迦吒富單那分取安置。
translation: Those of you who live in the cities and villages of Jambudvīpa or even those who rely on the springs and pools here will share your instructions with those gods, dragons, and Kāṭṭapūtanas so that they can take them and place them there.

source_sentence: 若彼諸天乃至迦吒富單那等，各捨己分猶作惱害、不遮惱他，應當治罰而折伏之。
translation: If those gods or even Kāṭapūtana abandon their parts and continue to cause harm or non-hindrance to others, they should be punished and subdued.

source_sentence: 願佛發勇作大佛事，一切盡皆分張安置。」
translation: May the Buddha have the courage to perform a great Buddha-act and place them all in proportion."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊說偈答曰：「於此佛法中，　　無有惱他義，　度於苦彼岸，　　諸處心平等。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān spoke a verse in reply, "In this Buddha's teaching, there's no point in disturbing others, and I've crossed to the other shore of suffering where my mind is equal.

source_sentence: 諸法無有二，　　導師捨憎愛，　一道如虛空，　　此是佛境界。
translation: There are no two dharmas, guides abandon hatred, and the single path is like space; this is the Buddha's realm.

source_sentence: 若有有為心，　　思惟去來事，　彼以法非法，　　能攝鬼神來。」
translation: If there's a sentient mind that contemplates things past and future, it can bring in demons and spirits because they're teachings and not teachings."

source_sentence: 爾時，復有一大梵天名曰正辯，住第十地聖無上聖，以諸菩薩功德莊嚴在會而坐。
translation: At the time, there was another great brahma god named Zhengbian, who resided in the tenth ground as a noble and unsurpassed sage and was sitting in the assembly adorned with the merits of the bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 此正辯天白諸天王、一切龍王、一切阿修羅王乃至一切迦吒富單那王，作如是言：「汝等如是，今從如來得聞是義，如佛世尊若行、若住、若坐、若臥不惱眾生。
translation: This god of right eloquence said to the god kings, all dragon kings, all asura kings, and all King Kāṭapūtana, "Thus, you have heard this meaning from the Tathāgata now, that if the Bhagavān walks, stands, sits, or lies down, he doesn't trouble sentient beings.

source_sentence: 汝等今悉一時同聲發願悕求，應當說言：『所有非人、一切天、龍、鬼神所攝，常食精氣，惱害於他食肉飲血者，彼等一切願護世四王力勢折伏；所有化生、濕生、胎生、卵生，如是隨其所有諸龍、夜叉、羅剎、阿修羅、伽樓羅、乾闥婆、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、鳩槃茶、餓鬼、毘舍遮、富單那、迦吒富單那一切等類四生所依。
translation: Now, all of you, speaking with one voice, should vow and seek, saying, 'Suppose you were to say, 'All those nonhumans and all gods, dragons, and ghosts who are fed with energy and who harm others by eating flesh and drinking blood, and all of them wish to protect the power of the four worldly kings to subdue them; all the creatures that are born from transformation, wet birth, womb birth, and egg birth, and so forth, all those dragons, yakṣas, rājas, asuras, garuḍas, gandharvas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, kumbhāṇas, hungry ghosts, piśācīs, pūtanas, and kaṭapūtanas, and all such kinds of beings who are the supports of the four kinds of beings.'

source_sentence: 彼等悉為四大天王力所攝伏，願四大王攝彼一切所不來者悉至於此。』」
translation: They are all subdued by the power of the four heavenly kings, so may the four great kings gather all of them that don't come here.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，一切天王乃至迦吒富單那王，作是願言：「除三十三天已下，所有四天王天及諸龍眾，乃至迦吒富單那四生所依一切無餘，悉願依於四大天王。
translation: At that point, all the god kings and even King Kāṭapūtana made this vow, saying, "Except for the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and below, there are no more four god kings or dragons or Kāṭapūtana who are the bases of four kinds of birth, so may they all rely on the four great heavenly kings.

source_sentence: 彼等四王力所攝伏，若有諸天乃至迦吒富單那等，於四天王如有違反一一王力不受教勅，即當為彼熾然鐵輪截其耳鼻。
translation: If those four kings are subdued by their power, and if the gods and even Kāṭapūtana violate the power of each of the four kings and don't accept their commands, that blazing iron wheel will cut off their ears and noses for them.

source_sentence: 若截耳鼻猶故違者，復令鐵輪截彼手足。
translation: If cutting off their ears and nose still makes them disobey, then they'll have their hands and feet cut off by the iron wheel.

source_sentence: 若截手足猶故違者，復斬其首。
translation: If cutting off their hands and feet still makes them disobey, then they'll have their heads chopped off again.

source_sentence: 若有乃至違四天王教勅之者，必令如是。」
translation: If there's anyone who disobeys the commands of the four heavenly kings, they'll surely be caused to do so."

source_sentence: 爾時，毘沙門天王即以熾然焰赫鐵輪向於北方而遙擲之，即說呪曰：「多地夜他　窮窮尼邏窮(其鳳反)　叉婆窮　伽佉伽伽　尼迦佉闍羅廁　蘇婆呵」爾時，毘樓博叉天王，亦以熾然焰赫鐵輪，向於西方而遙擲之。
translation: 爾時，毘沙門天王即以熾然焰赫鐵輪向於北方而遙擲之，即說呪曰：「多地夜他　窮窮尼邏窮(其鳳反)　叉婆窮　伽佉伽伽　尼迦佉闍羅廁　蘇婆呵」爾時，毘樓博叉天王，亦以熾然焰赫鐵輪，向於西方而遙擲之。

source_sentence: 復說呪曰：「多地夜他　尸梨器　尸羅器　伽伽那　尸梨器　叉尸羅器底　闍梨　蘇婆呵」爾時，毘樓勒叉天王亦以熾然焰赫鐵輪向於南方而遙擲之。
translation: He also spoke the mantra, "Dhṛtiyathā, śrāvastī, śrāvastī, jagannā, śrāvastī, kṣatriyaśrāvartī, and svāhā" when King Virūpākṣa also tossed it with a blazing, flaming iron wheel far to the south.

source_sentence: 即說呪曰：「多地夜他　闍邏鼻唎師　闍囉鼻唎師　悉多婆　闍囉鼻唎師　達羅尸　闍邏闍囉　鼻唎師　蘇婆呵」爾時，提頭賴吒天王亦以熾然焰赫鐵輪向於東方而遙擲之。
translation: He then spoke the mantra, "Dhṛtiyathā, jarājaprāpta, siddhârtha, jarājaprāpta, darāśi, jarājarāpta, and svāhā" At the time, the god Dhṛtarāṣṭra also tossed a blazing, fiery, iron wheel far to the east.

source_sentence: 即說呪曰：「多地夜他　阿那易(弋利反)阿那阿那耶　阿那浮毘　阿迦奢浮毘　摩系(下帝反)都易　蘇婆呵」爾時，四方諸天，乃至迦吒富單那，及諸大小樹林、藥草神等，遙見鐵輪熾然焰赫，悉大驚懼愁憂不樂恐命不存。
translation: He then spoke this dhāraṇī, "Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Ānāyin, Ānānaya, Ānabhūpi, Ākāśabhūpi, Mahêśvara, and Tuṣita," and the gods in the four directions, even Kāṭapūtana and the great and small forest and herb gods, saw the blazing iron wheel from afar and were all terrified and fearful, saddened and unhappy, for fear that their lives wouldn't be lost.

source_sentence: 觀十方已，各作念言：「誰當有能救於我等，為歸為趣施我等命？」
translation: After observing the ten directions, they each had a thought, "Who will be able to save us and give us our lives in return or return?"

source_sentence: 即便觀見大悲世尊如實利益諸眾生者，佉羅帝山牟尼諸仙所依住處，大眾悉集圍繞而坐。
translation: Even when he observes the Bhagavān truly benefiting all sentient beings, the sages of Kharādīpa gathered around him where he relies, and the whole crowd gathers around him and sits down.

source_sentence: 「唯彼當能救我等命。」
translation: "Only that person will be able to save our lives."

source_sentence: 即往佛所，疾如電光到佛前住。
translation: They then went to the Buddha and stayed there as quickly as a flash of lightning.

source_sentence: 如是十方所有諸天，乃至迦吒富單那等皆往佛所，到已而住。
translation: Thus, all the gods in the ten directions, even Kāṭapūtana and the others, went to the Buddha, arrived, and stayed there.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊欲重明此義而說偈言：「時我兩足尊，　　問釋梵四王，　為見為聞彼，　　過去諸導師，　分布四天下，　　為令天等護，　可不如我今，　　道樹下分布。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān wanted to explain this meaning again and spoke in verse, "I was two-legged and asked the four Śakra kings whether they had seen or heard of them, and whether the teachers of the past had distributed them throughout the four worlds so that the gods would protect them, but they weren't like me now, distributing them under the path tree.

source_sentence: 天王答我言，　　如是昔諸佛，　坐於道樹下，　　分與夜叉等，　後因過及時，　　轉生諸雜惡。
translation: The king of gods answered me, "Thus did the buddhas of yore sit under the path tree and distribute them to the yakṣas and so forth, and then, because of mistakes and timing, they gave rise to various bad qualities.

source_sentence: 鳩槃龍夜叉，　　羅剎鬼單那，　穬惡無慈愍，　　常食他肉血，　彼惱於諸國，　　及惱四姓人，　非時作風雨，　　及以寒熱等，　飢饉病鬪諍，　　滅壞大地味，　無慈於一切，　　惱害多眾生。
translation: The kumbhāṇḍas, dragons, yakṣas, and rāṣṭrapāla ghosts lack compassion, often eat the flesh and blood of others, plague lands and trouble people of four castes, cause unseasonable rain and wind, cold and heat, hunger, sickness, strife, destroy the taste of the earth, lack compassion for all, and inflict harm on many sentient beings.

source_sentence: 莫能遮護者，　　不伏於我等，　是以地精氣，　　眾生精氣沒，　正法妙精氣，　　難得者日損。
translation: There's no one who can protect them and doesn't subdue us, so the vitality of the earth and the vitality of sentient beings are lost, and the wonderful vitality of the true teaching is diminished day by day when it's difficult to attain it.

source_sentence: 時過因緣故，　　天人等損減，　增長諸惡世，　　法朋難可得，　法不久住世，　　滅壞正法燈，　斷絕三寶種，　　世間當盲冥。
translation: Because of the causes and conditions of time and error, gods and humans are diminished, the bad world grows, the Dharma friend is difficult to obtain, the Dharma doesn't last long, the lamp of the right Dharma is destroyed, the seed of the Three Treasures is cut off, and the world will be blinded.

source_sentence: 今佛大勇猛，　　於白法盡時，　出現閻浮提，　　大悲眾生藥，　中言具六通，　　究了諸法岸，　利益眾生故，　　作此大集會。
translation: Now, the Buddha is so bold that he appears in Jambudvīpa at the end of the white dharma, greatly pities the medicine for sentient beings, speaks with the six powers in his midst, fully comprehends the shores of all dharmas, and creates this great assembly for the benefit of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 一切天龍王，　　護世等來集，　諸鬼惡無慈，　　恒食他肉血，　龍鬼富單那，　　彼等不來此，　無所受教令，　　不依屬他分。
translation: All the gods and dragon kings, world protectors and others who come to assemble, demons who are unkind and evil, who constantly feed on the flesh and blood of others, and dragons and ghosts like Pūtanā, don't come here, don't receive instructions, and don't rely on other parts.

source_sentence: 一切受佛語，　　令彼皆來集，　願分於彼等，　　各令有所囑，　不令更惱害，　　奪他精氣等，　三種精氣住，　　令人修法行。
translation: They all accept the Buddha's words, cause them all to come to the assembly, wish to share with each of them a mandate, prevent them from being further harmed, rob others of their vitality, and so forth, and abide in the three kinds of vitality that cause people to cultivate the practice of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 白法得增長，　　黑法得消滅，　以是惡道息，　　天人得增益，　解脫門得開，　　三寶種熾然，　福流諸眾生，　　速能得解脫。
translation: As a result, white dharmas will grow, black dharmas will cease, evil destinies will cease, gods and humans will gain, the gate of liberation will be opened, the seeds of the Three Treasures will become blazing, and the flow of merit will quickly lead to the liberation of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 于時我嘿然，　　不隨於彼等，　梵王諸帝釋，　　四大護世王，　俱白一切眾，　　所來在會者，　勸請天人師，　　攝諸鬼來此，　分張付囑彼，　　城邑諸村落，　晝夜常護持，　　各令住自分。
translation: At the time, I was calm, not following them, and the Brahmā kings, the emperors, and the four great world-protecting kings all explained that they were all present at the meeting, urged the teachers of gods and humans to gather the demons here, handed out assurances to them, and kept the cities and villages guarded by day and night so that each would abide in its own part.

source_sentence: 菩薩等大眾，　　從座起合掌，　勸請大導師，　　攝諸鬼來此，　一切分作分，　　護持閻浮提，　勿惱於眾生，　　發勇人中上。
translation: The bodhisattvas and the rest of the assembly rose from their seats and put their palms together, exhorted the great guide, gathered the demons here, made all their parts known, defended Jambudvīpa, didn't disturb sentient beings, and arouse courage among humans.

source_sentence: 我不惱亂他，　　遠離去來事，　了知法無二，　　離諸眾生想。
translation: I won't disturb others, I'll distance myself from past and future events, I'll understand that dharmas are not two, and I'll be free of the conceptions of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 正辯大梵王，　　告諸天王言，　導師不惱他，　　佛法無此事，　悉共發願言，　　令鬼不為害，　分布各依止，　　彼四天王等。
translation: The eloquent king Brahmā told the god kings, "Guide them, don't vex them, the Buddha's teaching is unimpeded, and they all make a common vow that ghosts won't be harmed and that they'll distribute them to support the four heavenly kings and so forth.

source_sentence: 諸王作是言，　　我今依汝語，　誓勅於彼等，　　悉令得作分。
translation: The kings then said, "Now, I've relied on your words and vowed to make them all partakers of the teaching.

source_sentence: 若彼不依教，　　速為輪所燒，　于時四天王，　　使輪向四方，　乃至一時頃，　　盡皆到佛所，　頂禮世尊足，　　合掌於彼住。」
translation: If they don't follow your teaching, they'll quickly be burned by the wheel, and then the four heavenly kings will cause the wheel to go in all directions, even for an instant, and they'll all go to the Buddha, bow at the Bhagavān's feet, put their palms together, and stay there."

source_sentence: 大集經卷第四十九
translation: (Daji jing, vol. 49)
